3 peeko the elephant finishing 1 stuff body do not sew shut you may wish to put some plastic pellets in the bottom of the body before stuffing to add some weight and stability if you do i recommend placing the pellets inside a small fabric pouch before putting them in the body otherwise they are likely to eventually fall out between the spaces of the single crochets this is not only messy but also a potential choking hazard for small children i cut two circles roughly 3 in diameter from scrap fabric sew them together leaving a 1 opening fill the pouch with a scant ¼ cup of pellets and then sew the opening shut 2 sew head to body using inside loops only of last round of body 3 stuff arms lightly and sew to body 4 weave ends in ears and then sew ears to head i usually sew them between round 8 & 9 5 stuff base of trunk lightly and sew to face using inside loops only of last round of trunk 6 sew felt eyes to face alternatively embroider eyes to face 7 embroider eyebrows and mouth fig 4 5 tail with mc cut 3 pieces 8 long each stack the pieces on top of each other forming a bundle with mc cut 1 piece 24 long tie the bundle in half with this piece leaving a 16 long tail the long strand fig 6 fold the bundle in half and sew to body using the long strand wrap the long strand around the base of the elephant s tail a few times once it s sewn on fig 7 braid the tail using all eight strands fig 8 the long strand will still be quite long but you ll use that extra length at the tip of the tail wrap the long strand around the bottom of the braid a few times and then fasten_off fig 9 trim tail as desired © 2008 hooked on fauna all rights reserved -
